alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 10:02PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Laurel, southern Jackson, east central Rockcastle and northwestern Clay Counties through 1030 PM EST... At 1002 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over London, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Carico, Hazel Patch, Annville, Deese, Fogertown, Cruise, Royrader, Datha, Moores Creek, and Parrot around 1010 PM EST. Ardery, Atkinstown, Olin, Tyner, Zekes Point, Herd, Gray Hawk, Egypt, Mildred, and Shepherdtown around 1015 PM EST. McKee, Privett, Bradshaw, Mummie, Hurley, Sourwood, Nathanton, and Maulden around 1020 PM EST. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 29 and 49. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 3 and 11. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
